content: If anyone is interested, we are having a meeting to discuss Backdrop LIve tomorrow at 2:30pm (Pacific Time / USA). We'll open a Jit.si room here in the channel.

If you are interested in helping to plan Backdrop LIVE or just want to keep informed on our progress, please join the "Event Planning" stream. As activities ramp up, I think we'll move most of our discussions there.

We do have a meeting planned in 1 hour and I expect we will just post a jit.si meeting link in that channel.

Meeting starts in EXACTLY 4 minutes. https://meet.jit.si/828714782055845

;-)

exactly...

Let's check in later.
@jenlampton During Dev meeting yesterday, I announced a planning a meeting for Backdrop LIVE today at 2:30pm Pacific. If you are interested, see the Event PLanning stream for details.

Does anyone want to test the registration for Backdrop LIVE.

There is a voluntary donation form, you can skip that step.
https://events.backdropcms.org/

Seems to work fine. Some feedback:

  • It took me a few seconds to work out that registering an account on the site was different to registering for the event - Can we make this more obvious, and/or just combine them so that registering an account is registering for the event?
  • Once I was logged in and registered, there's no indication that I've done so (no message/details on my user profile, and the Register button on the homepage was still there)

@BWPanda Thanks for feedback.

I tested a module that would create an account on the site when you register for the event, but then you might not realize that you did create an account on the site.

We can register people for the event with site registration, because we plan to have registration on this site for other events. This is not simply for Backdrop LIVE, but we can also use it for VUG meetings and other events.
BUT, we can provide better instructions and feedback on the process.
Ah ok
We can improve the process or try other things, but I just wanted to get it working tonight in the best way possible.
I will at least add better help text tonight and/or confirmation messages.

The module that creates a new account with event registration would work nicely, if it also sent confirmation that a site account had been created. If we fix that, we can combine these two things into one.
Also, we are always talkng about single sign-on for all our sites. That would be nice.
I had to cancel my credit card a few days ago; waiting for a replacement before I register/donate.
...I could register and skip donation, but I'd like to test the UX.
It's not working ATM anyway :smiling_face:

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org/issues/7

Donation Form is not working · Issue #7 · backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org
We have a donation form set up with PayPal, but it's not working. @jenlampton - Can you check this out and see what happened? Did I break it? If so, sorry. https://events.backdropcms.org/donate

Backdrop LIVE registration is open - the event is coming up on March 12/13. We are asking for a $20 donation (any amount is acceptable) or to volunteer to help with the event.

https://events.backdropcms.org/

Please, let us know how the registration process goes.

NOTE: It's a new registration process, using relatively recently ported Drupal 7 modules - so we're working out the problems as we go. We plan to use this new events.backdropcms.org site to manage registrations for all future events (including our VUGs), so anything we fix now will help us down the road.
Why are both the mobile phone and email required? They shouldn't be necessary to process a credit card transaction.

I think that is part of the paypal process. I'm not sure if we have any control over that. We are just using a widget generated by PayPal (for now).

Yes, we could create a custom payment form and have some control over those things, but we didn't have time. I don't know why a phone number would be required.

NOTE: I have not yet tested the payment process myself and did not set it up. But, I know that we had some difficulties getting any widget to work. :-(
I'll take a look at that as soon as I have time.
Can you do the register button as a block with some logic to redirect to login and thus skip the "Access Denied"?

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org/issues

backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org
Backdrop LIVE events. Contribute to backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - Thanks for opening issues in the events.backdropcms.org issue queue. This is super helpful.

It's definitely the best place to discuss these issues. And this site will continue to be used after Backdrop LIVE, so we'll want to continue to improve it.

Some of your ideas are things we just didn't have time to do, but we do want to do and having open issue is great. Some of them, I will try to work on in the next 48 hours.
Please, do ping me directly in Zulip if you find anything that you think NEEDS to be addressed immediately.
I understand. I was mostly just putting things up there so they didn't _have_ to be remembered, but also wouldn't get forgotten.
I am willing to help with any of that, but I don't want to spend hours getting a dev environment set up to do it.
We need to get the same Lando file as on the other b.org repos into this one then. That'll make local devlopment much easier.
I've created a github issue with some suggestions for how folks can help us out.

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/771

BLIVE - How to help? · Issue #771 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Backdrop LIVE is happening in just over 1 week. We are running behind in planning, but expect the community to pull together and make this happen. Here are the things that we need help with. We nee...

blive.png

Zoom:https://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings-new

We are also testing the use of a MURAL board for Backdrop LIVE. Please, try logging in and helping us test this out - even if you can't join us in ZOom.
http://bit.ly/3bgR3ye

You should be able to login to this board without any account. Just login as guest and please experiment with the board, make edits, etc.

Backdrop LIVE

Regarding the registration process... A message after successful registration would definitely be helpful. I think, this has been mentioned before somewhere here in zulip (?).

What was the reason to not use the Software Freedom Conservancy account for that? This probably has been asked before, too. :wink:
IIRC it's cause they have not given us their PayPal code, so we can't send them money and have it be allocated to our account.
@indigoxela - Yes, apparently it takes longer than we planned for to arrange a PayPal connection to the Software Freedom Conservancy. We'll try to sort this out in advance of the next event.
I can probably give some time to helping set up the CiviCRM installation before the next event if that's still in the plans. Then the registration could be done through that system.

@Laryn Thanks for that offer, it's very interesting and a bit complicated. I would suggest that we have Backdrop CMS infrastructure meeting after Backdrop LIVE to address this and a bunch of related issues.

We do want to keep the events.backdropcms.org website going for future events (VUG and Backdrop LIVE), so we are trying to build out a long term registration system. I don't think we properly considered CiviCRM. But, there are other discussions around using CiviCRM for volunteer management that are bogged down in figuring out how to integrate with existing data on BackdropCMS.org. Also, there is the issue of single sign-on for all our sites. Maybe we need a plan to address these issues at once.

The problem with the PayPal form is not a factor here. That is really just a bureaucratic issue with the Software Freedom Conservancy that CivicCRM would not solve. But, the CiviCRM idea is still worth considering.

Laryn said:

I can probably give some time to helping set up the CiviCRM installation before the next event if that's still in the plans. Then the registration could be done through that system.

I would be willing to assist on that if it is something people want to try. I can also
take on the responsibility of keeping civi up to date once we have it running; can just absorb that into the update cycle I keep up with for clients.
If you are interested in the details of preparing for Backdrop LIVE, please be sure to join the Event Planning Stream. There is additional discussion happening there.

I just released a new module, User Time Zone Tokens, then went to the Backdrop Live page and saw this line:

Our next Backdrop LIVE is happening on March 12-14 (depending upon where you live).

If I may say so, this is an ideal use case for this module (and it was situations like this that prompted me to write it).

The module lets you create time-zone-aware tokens for dates and times and you can use them anywhere you can use tokens (which includes formatted text, if you use the Token Filter module).

Using User Time Zone Tokens, you could have that say

Our next Backdrop LIVE is happening from March 12, 6:00am PST to March 13, 10:00am PST

and have the date, time, and time zone be correct for the current user—even anonymous users.

So if that looks interesting, please take a look at the module. Suggestions, bug-finds, bug-fixes, and anything else are all welcome!
@bugfolder - We will definitely look at this. I've been in search of a solution like this and know that there are a couple of other options out there I need to test as well. Thanks.

backdrop-contrib/cs_date_formatter

I didn't participate in the recent Backdrop LIVE event and now I rather wish I had. But I am a rather cautious person and it all looked rather complicated. Is there a simple explanation somewhere of what it is? Is it a Zoom meeting with added features? I think I could cope with joining one of those. Perhaps someone who did participate but is not actually an organiser or presenter could write a short review of how it worked for them?

Its a bunch of Zoom meetings. E.g. 1pm, Zoom meeting about future of Backdrop. 2pm, two Zoom meetings: one about CiviCRM, other about migrating from D7 to Backdrop (participants have to choose which one they'll attend).
Each Zoom meeting is basically just a bunch of people discussing that particular topic. Someone's in charge and leading the discussion, but its not a structured presentation or anything.
That's basically it.
Maybe somewhere should be written down at least brief information about all sessions with the results (if any)?

I participated, and it was my first. I didn't present, just attended sessions that looked interesting; mostly sat back and listened, but occasionally found a place to chime in on the discussion. I learned a lot, found the presenters and other audience members very friendly and welcoming, and am very much looking forward to the next one!

In future I believe we should record all the events: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/775

Record ALL meetings/virtual events · Issue #775 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
We have 3 different types of events/meetings in Backdrop: Weekly meetings Virtual user groups Backdrop LIVE events Of those, only the weekly meetings are regularly recorded. Since the Backdrop comm...

@Graham Oliver - We had numerous different discussions during Backdrop LIVE, but logistically they were all in one room. I had the sense that participation this time was easier than last time, but I would love additional feedback on that. I think we will get better at explaining it to people next time.

To participate this time, all you had to do was come to the single room we set up (the path never changed) at any of the appointed times. During some time slots, we broke into breakout rooms within Zoom and we had a volunteer there to help you as needed.

I will try to write a summary of Backdrop LIVE from the perspective of an organizer and share links to any resources and notes that were generated. I would love to see a similar summary from the perspective of someone that was not an organizer.

If anyone has additional feedback, let us know.

For those who are interested, our plans are to hold Backdrop LIVE events every release cycle (3 times per year), the next one is planned for July 10th (approximately). There was some feedback that this might be too frequent and/or that July 10th is in the midst of vacation season.

We discussed this during the Outreach meeting today and the overall sentiment seems to be that we should stick with 3 events per year that are smaller and less formal and that given other scheduling issues, we might as well stick with July 10th for this year, recognizing the conflicts at that time of year. Part of the reason for doing 3 per year, is to provide enough opportunities for participation that no one needs to feel too bad about missing one. We expect that one event per year will be bigger than the others and that one is likely to take place in the fall.

@StPaulTim I can confirm your impression, that it was easier to participate, because the "starting point" has always been the same room.

Personally, I find 3 events per year better than just one. Of course, I'm aware that it's more work for the organizers, and that it might change at some point.

What I like about the live event is, that I have the chance to connect the name of community members with a face and a voice. IMO this makes collaboration easier, Github / Zulip usernames are a bit abstract. And the informal format encourages creative brainstorming - also something that's not so easy in the more formal Github issue queue, where we're supposed to stick with a single topic.

Looking forward to participate next time. :smiley:
Thank you very much for helpful explanations.
